intro: Trigonostemon stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
